module mymod

contains

    logical function is_valid(c1, c2, c3, c4)
        integer(kind=8), intent(in) :: c1, c2, c3, c4
        integer(kind=8) :: chars(4), temp
        integer :: i

        ! Check all four permutations

        ! Original
        chars = [c1, c2, c3, c4]
        if (check_substrings(chars)) then
            is_valid = .false.
            return
        endif

        ! Swap 0 and 1
        chars = [c2, c1, c3, c4]
        if (check_substrings(chars)) then
            is_valid = .false.
            return
        endif

        ! Swap 1 and 2
        chars = [c1, c3, c2, c4]
        if (check_substrings(chars)) then
            is_valid = .false.
            return
        endif

        ! Swap 2 and 3
        chars = [c1, c2, c4, c3]
        if (check_substrings(chars)) then
            is_valid = .false.
            return
        endif

        is_valid = .true.

    contains

        logical function check_substrings(chars)
            integer(kind=8), intent(in) :: chars(4)
            check_substrings = .false.
            ! Check positions 1-3 and 2-4 (since Fortran uses 1-based)
            if ( (chars(1) == 0 .and. chars(2) == 1 .and. chars(3) == 2) .or. &
                 (chars(2) == 0 .and. chars(3) == 1 .and. chars(4) == 2) ) then
                check_substrings = .true.
            endif
        end function check_substrings

    end function is_valid

end module mymod

program main
    use mymod
    implicit none

    integer(kind=8) :: N, i, s, c, ans
    integer(kind=8) :: c1, c2, c3, remainder, new_s
    integer(kind=8), allocatable :: dp(:,:)

    read(*,*) N

    allocate(dp(0:N, 0:63))
    dp = 0
    dp(0, 63) = 1  ! Initial state is TTT (code 63)

    do i = 0, N-1
        do s = 0, 63
            if (dp(i, s) == 0) cycle

            c1 = s / 16
            remainder = mod(s, 16)
            c2 = remainder / 4
            c3 = mod(remainder, 4)

            do c = 0, 3
                if (is_valid(c1, c2, c3, c)) then
                    new_s = mod(s, 16) * 4 + c
                    dp(i+1, new_s) = mod(dp(i+1, new_s) + dp(i, s), MOD)
                end if
            end do
        end do
    end do

    ans = sum(dp(N, :))
    print *, mod(ans, MOD)

    deallocate(dp)
end program main
